page.title: 02FARMING SOMERSET MENDIPS
page.content: There are 14 farms centred on this area, about half belong to Ammerdown Estate. These have striven for greater efficiency over the last 20 years; some have been amalgamated and their boundaries extended into other areas. They are partly co-operative, sharing machinery and grain drying facilities. The privately owned farms are smaller, 50 - 200 acres, some having been in the same family for many generations. With relatively high rainfall, dairying is still of major importance. Although some have abandoned it, many of the larger farms have increased their herds of friesans. Some keep beef cattle and there is a large privately owned pig farm at Newbury. Two small flocks of Jacobs sheep reflect interest in rare breeds.
